result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Eric A. Zweifel was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing hearing on January 19, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Review hearing on January 19, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Order for Predisposition Investigation (Not Guilty by Reasons of Mental Disease or Defect) signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr. November 3, 2022.
Order of Commitment (Not Guilty by Reasons of Mental Disease of Defect) signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr. November 3, 2022.

1:51 PM; Case called for Plea hearing.  Defendant Eric A. Zweifel in court.  Attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy in court for Eric A. Zweifel.  Attorney Susan L. Opper in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes the plea questionnaire has been previously e-filed and the pleas will be to Counts 1 & 5 of the Amended Information and all other Counts will be dismissed and read in.  Atty. LaVoy confirms that information.  Court inquires if sentencing will occur today as well.  Atty. LaVoy advises both he and the State agree to adjourn the matter for sentencing and are asking the Court prepare on order for predisposition investigation.  Atty. LaVoy acknowledges receipt of the Amended Information and waives reading.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant. Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Counts 1 & 5, Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 5 but based on the findings in the doctor's report, filed on 8/31/22, and will find the defendant not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court will also order that Counts 2-4, 6 & 7 be dismissed and read in.  Court will order a Predisposition Investigation, to be completed and report filed by 12/05/2022, for determination of placement.  Court will adjourn for review of the report and for sentencing.
Review hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Detective, of the Jay Carpenter of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by DA Opper.
Cross examination by attorney LaVoy.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.
